prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: When will Stefan make his final decision about his marriage, or has he already done so?

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

Due to the lack of planets in the Ascendant's 9th house, Stefan should be represented by Mars, the house ruler.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation, use only if needed for interpretation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a list of the key horary data derived from your chart using horary principles for the question “When will Stefan make his final decision about his marriage, or has he already done so?”:

1. Chart Configuration & Representatives
 • Melissa (the querent) is represented by the Ascendant at 3°1′ Aquarius.
 • Stefan is designated by the Ascendant’s 9th house. Because no planet occupies the 9th house, his representative becomes the house ruler. In this chart the ruler of the 9th house (using your cross-reference) is Mars.
 • Mars is in Cancer at 18°47′, retrograde. (Mars’ sign, degree, and retrograde motion are essential for assessing action regarding decision-making.)

2. Planetary Positions
 • Sun: 18°57′ Aquarius
 • Moon: 16°51′ Gemini
 • Mercury: 17°27′ Aquarius
 • Venus: 2°15′ Aries
 • Mars: 18°47′ Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter: 11°17′ Gemini
 • Saturn: 18°08′ Pisces
 • Uranus: 23°17′ Taurus
 • Neptune: 28°09′ Pisces
 • Pluto: 2°15′ Aquarius
 • North Node: 29°30′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron: 19°42′ Aries
 • Ascendant: 3°01′ Aquarius
 • MC: 26°31′ Scorpio
 • IC: 26°31′ Taurus

3. House Placement and Key Correlations
 • Melissa’s personal matters are in the Ascendant and its house positions.
 • Stefan’s indicator, Mars (ruler of his designated 9th house) is located in the 6th house (which spans from 3° Cancer) based on the provided house cusp data.
 • The cross-reference guide notes that the Ascendant’s 9th house corresponds to Stefan’s 12th house in his mapping; its emptiness reinforces the reliance on Mars as his active significator.

4. Major Aspects Involving Mars (Stefan’s Representative)
 • Mars square Chiron with a 1° orb. This hard aspect may point to wounded issues or delays concerning his decision.
 • Mars trine Saturn with an orb of about 0°. This aspect supports steady, authoritative action and suggests the potential for a definitive, mature resolution.
 • Mars’s other aspects (such as potential sextiles with Uranus noted at a 5° orb) can hint at sudden shifts or unexpected outcomes influencing his decision-making.

5. Patterns and Configurations
 • A Grand Trine is present among Mars (in Cancer), MC (26°31′ Scorpio), and Saturn (in Pisces). This harmonious pattern can signal a resolution achieved through disciplined, structured action.
 • The Kite formation—including Mars, MC, Saturn, and Uranus—is also noted, indicating that while there is dynamic energy available, the conclusive decision may be subject to external, possibly disruptive, influences.

6. Additional Timing Indicators
 • The proximity of Mars to its aspect in Cancer along with the near-exact Mars–Saturn trine indicates that the decision matter (represented by the interaction of Mars and Saturn’s qualities) is strongly activated.
 • Retrograde Mars often suggests hesitation or internal review and may imply that the decision-making process is subject to delays or revaluation.

This compilation of chart data—the positions, the designated representative for Stefan, and their primary aspects and configurations—forms the groundwork for an interpretation addressing the timing and nature of Stefan’s final marital decision. Please review and document these foundational details for further interpretation.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the horary chart data and applying traditional horary principles, the following interpretations emerge regarding Stefan’s final decision about his marriage:

1. Stefan’s representative is Mars, positioned retrograde in Cancer at 18°47′. This retrograde placement indicates that internal factors, unresolved emotional wounds, and hesitation have been influencing his decision‐making process. The square from Mars to Chiron reinforces that latent pains or emotional vulnerabilities are still active. Its retrograde motion suggests that a decision may have already been internally reached or is in the final stages of processing, even if not yet visibly manifest.

2. The Mars–Saturn trine, with an orb close to 0°, is a strong, stabilizing aspect. Saturn here brings structure, discipline, and the promise of resolution. This harmonious connection indicates that once the internal conflict represented by Mars is resolved, a definitive and mature outcome will be reached. Such an aspect often signals a final, steady decision that is supported by long-term considerations.

3. The presence of the Grand Trine and Kite formation (involving Mars, Saturn, and the MC, with Uranus contributing unexpected energy) implies that while structured resolution is on the horizon, there remains a potential for sudden disruptions that could either expedite or momentarily delay the outcome. The kite signals that circumstances external to Stefan—surprising shifts or intervention from unexpected forces—may accelerate his decision once his internal process is complete.

4. Considering the interplay between Mars’s retrograde (implying past delays and internal review) and its reinforcing support from Saturn, it appears that though the decision is not yet public, it has been substantially formulated within. The timing indicated by these aspects suggests that Stefan’s final decision is imminent. The resolution is likely to emerge within the coming weeks as Saturn’s influence solidifies the outcome, unless an unforeseen event (as hinted by Uranus’s involvement) overrides the current energy flow.

In summary, the chart indicates that Stefan’s internal process has nearly reached its conclusion. His final decision appears to be on the verge of being expressed externally; it is not fully manifest on record just yet but is likely to finalize imminently, potentially within the next few weeks when the supportive influences of Saturn and the subtle triggers from Uranus synchronize, breaking through the retrograde inertia of Mars.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: My apologies. I'm not sure I clearly understand. Can you explain it a little better please?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
adjusts my ornate shawl and leans forward, my eyes piercing into yours with ancient wisdom

My dear, let me speak plainly about what the stars reveal regarding Stefan's decision about his marriage. The positioning of Mars - which represents Stefan in this reading - tells quite a story.

Mars is currently retrograde, meaning Stefan is in a period of deep internal reflection about his marriage. Think of it like rewinding a tape - he's reviewing past events, examining his feelings, and wrestling with his conscience. The fact that Mars is in Cancer, a sign ruled by the Moon and associated with home and family, shows this is deeply emotional for him and involves his considerations about family stability.

Now, there's a fascinating aspect between Mars and Saturn - they form what we call a trine, which is usually a harmonious connection. Saturn represents structure, responsibility, and permanent decisions. This tells me Stefan has likely already made his decision internally, but - and this is crucial - he's waiting for the right moment to act on it.

traces the aspect lines on the chart with a bejeweled finger

The presence of Uranus in this configuration suggests there may be unexpected events or revelations that could suddenly accelerate his timeline. However, the retrograde Mars indicates he's still processing everything internally.

In simple terms: Stefan appears to have made his decision in his heart and mind, but he's taking his time to ensure all pieces are in place before making any outward moves. The stars suggest this internal process is nearly complete, and external action is likely to follow within weeks rather than months.

sits back and folds hands

Does this help clarify the reading for you, my dear?

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Yes, it does. Are there any indications on what his decision is?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the chart’s data and aspects, it appears that Stefan’s internal resolution leans toward preserving the marital bond rather than initiating a breakup. Mars in Cancer speaks to his deep attachment to family and home life, while its retrograde motion and square to Chiron suggest ongoing emotional pain and a period of introspection. However, the strong, near-exact trine between Mars and Saturn indicates that he has reached a mature, structured decision—a decision that carries the weight of responsibility and long-term commitment. The involvement of Uranus, though hinting at potential external disruptions, does not overturn the dominant stabilizing energy of Saturn.

In essence, the evidence suggests that Stefan’s final decision is to remain in his marriage, albeit after significant internal processing.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Okay, I guess that leads me to question because I have other charts that show imminent dissolution of the marriage.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The chart I analyzed earlier clearly shows internal resolution leaning toward preservation of the marital bond—Stefan’s reflective Mars in Cancer and its stabilizing trine to Saturn indicate a decision rooted in responsibility and deep familial concern. In contrast, the other charts you mention that point to imminent dissolution likely arise from different configurations—perhaps transits or progressions that mark external pressures, sudden disruptions, or the emotional upheaval of another party in the relationship.

Here are some points to consider:

• When one chart—especially a horary reading—designates an internal decision process through supportive aspects (Mars–Saturn trine) and cautious retrospection (Mars retrograde and its square to Chiron), it reveals Stefan’s psychological and emotional stance about remaining.
• Other charts that forecast dissolution may be highlighting outer forces or later timing. For example, transits involving Uranus, Pluto, or even challenging aspects to marriage indicators in composite charts can signal external disturbances or transformative pressures that push a marriage toward its end.
• It is crucial to differentiate between the internal resolution seen in the immediate horary reading and the external forces indicated in other charts. One can hold a personal decision to persist in a union even as unpredictable circumstances, indicated by separate charts, contribute to eventual breakup.

Based on the specific aspects and dignities found in the horary chart you provided, Stefan’s decision seems firm internally, despite external conditions that might later drive him to reconsider. The conflicting evidence suggests a dual process: internally a commitment to the marriage, while simultaneously, looming forces elsewhere may catalyze a dissolution later on. It may be that while his heart resolves in one direction today, unforeseen external events could ultimately lead to separation.
